name: Isocarboxazid (Marplan)
summary: A non-selective, irreversible monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) used for depression, typically reserved for treatment-resistant cases.
description: Isocarboxazid is a non-selective, irreversible MAOI that increases synaptic levels of serotonin, norepinephrine, and dopamine. It is generally used in treatment-resistant major depressive disorder and certain anxiety disorders. Due to dietary restrictions and interaction risks, it is usually prescribed when other treatments have failed.

contraindications: Concurrent use of serotonergic drugs or sympathomimetics

sections.text: Irreversibly inhibits monoamine oxidase A and B, preventing the breakdown of serotonin, norepinephrine, and dopamine.

adult.titrate: Increase by 10 mg/day every 2–4 days as tolerated

sections.geriatric: Use with caution; start lower and titrate slowly

sections.text: Full antidepressant effects typically take 2–4 weeks; irreversible MAO inhibition lasts ~2 weeks after discontinuation.

sections.black_box: Antidepressants increase the risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
other: 2-week washout required when switching to or from serotonergic drugs

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.geriatrics: Increased risk of hypotension and drug interactions

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose to avoid withdrawal symptoms; maintain a 2-week washout before starting serotonergic or sympathomimetic drugs.

items: Reserved for patients who have not responded to other antidepressants
Patients should carry a medication card or alert bracelet indicating MAOI use
